$!
You pay National Insurance if your profits are above £5,595 and you'll pay more when your profits rise above £7,605. 
$!

Annual profits | Class 2 | Class 4
 - | - | -
Up to £5,595 | £0 but only if you get an exemption | £0
£5,595 - £7,604 | £2.65 a week | £0
£7,605 - £42,475 | £2.65 a week | 9% of profits
More than £42,475 | £2.65 a week | 9% of profits up to £42,475 and 2% over that amount

Class 2 is paid by either direct debit or you can ask HM Revenue & Customs to bill you twice a year. 

Class 4 is paid through your Self Assessment tax return. 

##Apply for a Class 2 exception 

This is sometimes called a 'Certificate of Small Earnings Exception (SEE)'. To apply, use form CF10. 

$D [Download 'Form CF10, Application for exception from liability for Class 2 contributions' (PDF, 90KB)](http://search2.hmrc.gov.uk/kb5/hmrc/forms/view.page?record=yKpjabZqCc8&formid=433 "Download 'Form CF10, Application for exception from liability for Class 2 contributions' (PDF, 90KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

title: Self-employed National Insurance rates
